name: overgeneralize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to say or write that something is true all of the time, when it is only true some of the time: It's important not to overgeneralize about people in this age group. I really believe he tends to overgeneralise in this article.
More examplesFewer examplesMost of the points she makes are true, but her main problem is that she tends to overgeneralize.Their arguments seem to overgeneralise about the science, using broad words like "chemicals" and "poison".I don't want to overgeneralise, but most of the adverts were lacking in content and new information.
